title: Which foundry used “The Reflex” as sample text for a typeface specimen?
content:
You know those single-page specimens the kool kidz at foundries gin up to exhibit many variants of a typeface family on the same page? Each line tells a little story and uses its own variation, as seen on the left-hand page of the illustration for [<cite>David</cite> (“Fools!”) <cite>Berlow Type Specimens</cite>](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013133242/http:/www.fontbureau.com/books/dbspecimens "Book downloadable at Font Bureau").

But sometimes all the lines put together tell a _big_ story. I have a dim racial memory that one of our number used the lyrics of Duran Duran’s “The Reflex” in exactly this way. False-memory syndrome? If not, who did it? Don’t leave me answered with a question mark here.
author: joeclark
